trans-unit.target: TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_SEQ_00<tab>A teahouse serving girl of Kugane is at her wit's end due to the incessant repetitions of an ebrious citizen.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TODO_01<tab>Dump the pail of cold well water on the fabulously foxed fellow.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TODO_02<tab>Speak with the teahouse serving girl.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_000<tab>Enough! I can't stand it anymore. How many times are you going to recant the same old tired tale!?

TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_DRANKER02669_000_001<tab>Shut your mouth and open your earsh, you little bint! Thish shtatue is Zuiko of Clan Buhen─the greatesht warlord Hingashi has ever sheen! The founder of Suenokuni!
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_DRANKER02669_000_002<tab>Let's shee... How many yearsh ago were it that he...<burp>...were Lord of Suenokuni...
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_003<tab>Excuse me there, <var 08 E905 ((milady)) ((milord)) /var>. Would you please do something to cool off this hot-headed drunkard?

TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_004<tab>I've just now sent a teahouse hireling to fetch some water from the well. If you are able to find her, ask her for a pail of cold well water. I'll do what I can to keep this ale-soaked sod from bothering the other patrons until you return.

TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_005<tab>I've just now sent a teahouse hireling to fetch some water from the well. If you are able to find her, ask her for a pail of cold well water. I'll do what I can to keep this ale-soaked sod from bothering the other patrons until you return.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_DRANKER02669_000_006<tab>And thish here'sh the besht part of all. There were... There were... Damn it all. What were I jusht about to shay?

TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_APPRENTICE02669_000_010<tab>That drunkard is at it again, is he? Well, I've got just the thing for him. Here, take this pail of cold well water and give his head a good dousing. That always seems to do the trick.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_APPRENTICE02669_000_011<tab>Take that pail of cold well water and give that drunkard's head a good dousing. That always seems to do the trick.

TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_DRANKER02669_000_020<tab>Oh no, I've gone and got good and drunk again, aren't I? I'm sho shorry. It'sh jusht, I were a graveguard for the branch family of a branch family of a branch family of Clan Buhen, I were.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_DRANKER02669_000_021<tab>My love of the drink got me to where you shee me now. I didn't never mean to bother nobody. I'm shorry. Sho very, very shorry.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_022<tab>Go ahead and dump that pail of cold well water square on that drunken mummer's head!

TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_030<tab>Thank you for your trouble, stranger. I hate to admit it, but as prominent and well-to-do an establishment as our Umineko Teahouse is, we do find ourselves a close neighbor to the Hostelry. Drunkards are not as few and far between as we would like.

TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_031<tab>But that's not to say their lot is all bad. There are many whom the drink drives to be quite generous. Those souls are always willing to part with a pretty gil to buy whatever tea and sweets we recommend.
TEXT_STMBDZ119_02669_TEAHOUSE02669_000_032<tab>That is just one of the many reasons why I have come to love this city. I hope you come to grow as fond of it as I have. Good day to you, then!
